Package edu.uga.cs1302.txtbuff

Class TextLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uga.cs1302.txtbuff.TextLine
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EditableTextLine
    public class TextLine
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a line of text of characters. The first character is at position (index) 0 and the last is at line length -1 (just as in a Java array).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected int capacity  
      static int DEFAULT_SIZE
      Specifies the default capacity of a TextLine (set to 80).
      protected int length  
      protected char[] txtLine  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TextLine()
      Constructs an empty TextLine.
      TextLine​(java.lang.String line)
      Constructs a TextLine object intitialized to contain the same characters as in the argument line.

      • DEFAULT_SIZE

        public static final int DEFAULT_SIZE
        Specifies the default capacity of a TextLine (set to 80).
        See Also:

      • capacity

        protected int capacity

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextLine

        public TextLine()
        Constructs an empty TextLine. The line length should be set to 0, but the capcity of the internal array should be set to DEFAULT_SIZE.

      • TextLine

        public TextLine​(java.lang.String line)
        Constructs a TextLine object intitialized to contain the same characters as in the argument line. The line length should be set to the length of the arguments string, but the capacity of the internal array should be set to the smallest multiple of DEFAULT_SIZE, sufficient to store the entire line.
        Parameters:
        line - - argument

    • Method Detail

        Returns the length of this TextLine

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf​(java.lang.String fragment)
        Returns the index position of the first occurence of the fragment substring in this TextLine, or
        Parameters:
        fragment - - substring of line
        Returns:
        -1, if the fragment is not found.

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf​(java.lang.String fragment,
                   int fromIndex)
            throws TextLineIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the index position of the first occurence of the fragment substring in this TextLine, or
        Parameters:
        fragment - - substring of line
        fromIndex - - out of TextLine
        Returns:
        -1, if the fragment is not found.
        Throws:
        TextLineIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the supplied fromIndex is out of this TextLine (0 to length()-1

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
